item.title: Spectral Analysis of Bacteria S-Layer
item.description: Background Info: Bacteria S-Layers Introducing Hot Peanuts Step 1. Remove Vertical and Horizontal Pattern Noise Step 2. Identify Key Periodic Frequencies Step 3. Calculate Size and Scale Identify Shape Extra Credit: Visualize the S-Layer Units Conclusion Background Info: Bacteria S-Layers Most prokaryotic cells are encapsulated by a surface layer (S-layer) consisting of repeating units of S-layer proteins. These S-layers protect cells from the outside, provide mechanical stability, and play roles in spreading disease.

item.title: 1D and 2D Fourier Transforms
item.description: Fourier Transforms: A Pattern-Based Perspective 1D Fourier Transforms Understanding the 1D Math The DFT-matrix (W) Post Projection Processing Read the 1D Frequency Plots Generalizing to 2D Fourier Transform Understand the 2D Math Read the 2D Plots Exercises Further Reading Fourier Transforms: A Pattern-Based Perspective In the 1800s, Joseph Fourier showed that periodic functions could be written as an infinite sum of sinusoids.
